dialogs.line: You’ve made it far without armor. Ahead lies a dragon in its cave, guarding riches and glory.
And above is the tower, where knights gather in trust and unity. Without armor, you’ll reach the top with ease.
But that dragon won’t fall to words or trust. You’ll need armor to survive its claws and flames.
Armor may protect you, but it also weighs you down. The tower is your chance to embrace vulnerability and connection.

dialogs.question: Will you take armor for the dragon or climb the tower without it?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor. I need protection for the cave.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll climb the tower. No armor is needed there.

dialogs.line: Smart choice. This armor will keep you safe.
I hope it serves you well, though I wish you’d chosen connection over defense.
Good choice. The tower will show you the strength of trust and unity.
Bah! Trust won’t save you from a dragon’s wrath. But good luck, I suppose.
With one layer of armor, you’re protected, but is it enough? The dragon below will test your limits.
The tower above still calls to you. To climb, you’ll need to shed your defenses and trust in others.
Bah! Riches and glory are in the cave. Why risk it all for connection when treasure is so close?

dialogs.question: Will you take more armor for the dragon or shed your armor to climb the tower?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take more armor. I need all the protection I can get.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll shed this armor. I’m ready to climb the tower.

dialogs.line: Excellent choice. The dragon will be no match for you now.
I hope it serves you well, though I wish you’d chosen vulnerability over more defense.
You’ve made the right choice. Connection lies at the top of the tower, not behind walls of steel.
Bah! We’ll see how well trust serves you when danger strikes.
With two layers of armor, the dragon doesn’t stand a chance. But the climb? You’ll never make it like this.
If you truly seek community, you must let go of the weight holding you back. Vulnerability is the only way forward.

dialogs.question: What will you do? Keep your armor, shed it for the climb, or take a third layer?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll keep my armor. The dragon is my goal.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll shed my armor. I want to climb the tower.
dialogs.answer2: I’ll take more armor. I want to be unstoppable.

dialogs.line: Glory awaits! This armor will carry you to victory.
Be careful. Glory may not be as fulfilling as you think.
You’ve made the right choice. Connection is worth more than defense.
Hmph. You’ll regret this when danger strikes.
With three layers of armor, nothing will harm you. The dragon doesn’t stand a chance.
But at what cost? Even victory won’t help if you lose connection with others.
